version_description:
- Improved CarPlay
- Minor bug fixes
- Fix for iOS 9 users

- New design with many big and small UI improvements
- All-new watchOS 3 app
- Easy queue management
- Widget, rich notifications, 3D Touch, and more

3.0.1 is a minor bugfix update for 3.0, which had:
- New design with many big and small UI improvements
- All-new watchOS 3 app
- Easy queue management
- Widget, rich notifications, 3D Touch, and more

3.0.2 is a minor bugfix update for 3.0, which had:
- New design with many big and small UI improvements
- All-new watchOS 3 app
- Easy queue management
- Widget, rich notifications, 3D Touch, and more

- Minor bug fixes
- The triumphant return of swipe-to-delete (in addition to the new UI)

Fixed some crashes. Sorry about that.

(...sorry about the crashes, not sorry about fixing them)

Standalone Apple Watch playback! In any downloaded episode's Queue menu (⁺≡), select "Send to Watch". Pending transfers show in Downloads screen.

New dark app-icon option for Premium members, and miscellaneous bug fixes for everyone, too.
Fixed podcasts not playing under certain circumstances. Podcasts may require redownloading if this hit you — if so, I apologize.

Improved standalone Watch playback:
- Volume control with Digital Crown
- Speaker output if no headphones are connected
- More reliable in the background (Thanks, Steve Troughton-Smith!)

The Watch app also now has Previous/Next Episode by
Fixed background crashes and the failed-downloads bug.
More fixes, including background crashes from the widget.
Fixed the cause of Springboard crashes. (Wow. Truly sorry about that one.)
New 2.5X and 3X speed options, and smoother high-speed playback.

- Small fixes and improvements
- Added chapter navigation to Watch app and sped up the interface
- Sorry, I had to remove "Send to Watch" due to watchOS changes. Details at: https://marco.org/
A bigger update for iOS 11 is coming soon! This one's just a crash fix.

- Tons of miscellaneous UI updates and fixes
- Replaced stacked-cards interaction with horizontal navigation for simplicity and reachability
- iOS 11 drag and drop (basic for now, more coming later)

New in Nitpicky Details:
- One-tap-play

- New black theme option, in addition to the classic dark theme
- Can now choose either font with any theme
- Sleep timer "End of Episode" option
- Minor fixes and improvements
Minor fixes
Minor audio fixes.
Fixed a bug that could lose a few seconds or minutes of playback progress when resuming the current episode.

- New option to auto-delete episodes 24 hours after completion
- Password-protected podcasts are now supported (in the Add URL screen)
- New Smart Resume feature: Jumps back by up to a few seconds after having been paused to help remind you of the c

- Can now change or remove emails and passwords
- Images in show notes no longer auto-load to prevent ad tracking
- Adjusted Smart Resume timing in response to customer feedback
- Fixed slowdowns with large images
- Minor fixes
Fixes a crash on startup for some customers with a lot of podcasts.
Minor bug fixes.
Minor bug fixes and optimizations.
Dramatically improves the reliability of Watch transfers.

- Support for new iPad screen sizes
- Changed all Infograph complications on Apple Watch to the dark icon
- Fixed a bug that could cause crashing in the background
Minor bug fixes.

- Instant Search: Find and subscribe to podcasts much more quickly, even after typing only a single letter.
- Minor fixes, including more accurate seeking and duration detection for malformed podcast files.

- CarPlay improvements
- Other minor fixes

- Added buttons to quickly navigate to effects, info, and chapters on the playback screen
- Playback screen now includes the name of wireless audio devices, e.g. "Marco's AirPods", when active
- Removed speed control from CarPlay because it caused m
From the playback screen's Share button, you can now share video (!) or audio clips of podcasts. Share great moments and help new listeners find your favorite podcasts.
Minor clip-sharing bug fixes.

- Shared clips can now be up to 90 seconds long
- Downloading, deleting, and sorting can now be customized per-podcast
- New “Suggested for You” podcast recommendations, replacing the old Twitter integration
- Minor fixes
- Fixes a crash introduced in the previous version. Sorry about that.
Improved search and sync performance.
Minor fixes for crashes and compatibility.
Restores compatibility with watchOS 5.

- Voice Boost 2: Mastering-quality audio processing for consistent volume levels between podcasts.
- AirPlay 2: Optimized playback to HomePods and other AirPlay 2 devices.
- New per-podcast setting to skip intros and/or outros by a set duration.
Minor bug fixes, particularly when resuming playback in CarPlay.
Fixed crashes and minor audio bugs.

- More reliable Apple Watch downloads
- Bug fixes

- Improvements to the Add Podcast directory
- Bug fixes

- New Privacy screen on each podcast.
- Now uses system font by default. Choose your font in Theme settings.
- Minor bug fixes.
Minor bug fixes for iOS 14.
